Accomplice.definition: one who intentionally and voluntarily participates with another in a crime by encouraging or assisting in the commission of the crime or by failing to prevent it though under a duty to do so [the of the burglar] [an in a robbery]
Accomplice.origin: [alteration (from incorrect division of a complice ) of complice , from Middle French, associate, from Late Latin complic - complex partner, confederate]

1.1: one who intentionally and voluntarily participates with another in a crime by encouraging or assisting in the commission of the crime or by failing to prevent it though under a duty to do so [the of the burglar] [an in a robbery]
